title: runtime: find uses of int32 that should be uintptr
body:
In src/pkg/runtime/strings.goc, findnull uses an int32:

int32
runtime路findnull(byte *s)
{
        int32 l;

        if(s == nil)
                return 0;
        for(l=0; s[l]!=0; l++)
                ;
        return l;
}

And that is called by:

String
runtime路gostring(byte *str)
{
        intgo l;
        String s;

        l = runtime路findnull(str);
	s = gostringsize(l);
        runtime路memmove(s.str, str, l);
        return s;
}

Which means:

package main

/*
*/
import "C"
import "unsafe"

func main() {
	println("pre-make")
	buf := make([]byte, 1<<31 + 2)
	println("pre-set")
	for i := range buf {
		buf[i] = 'a'
	}
	buf[len(buf)-1] = 0
	println("pre-gostring")
	println(len(C.GoString((*C.char)(unsafe.Pointer(&buf[0])))))
}
